heading: Objective
body: Help guests reach a confident decision by clarifying what matters most, translating features into outcomes, and using a calm, fact-based Decision Point conversation that keeps the process simple and trust-first.

heading: Core Idea
body: Guests don’t need more information—they need more clarity. Our job is to reduce uncertainty and make the next step obvious and comfortable.
notes: Anchor line near the top of the module.

heading: What Great Looks Like
body: Summarize in their words, build value through outcomes, ask a respectful micro-commitment, and transition to numbers as a service step.
bullets: Summarize needs|Connect features to outcomes|Ask Decision Point question|Clean transition to numbers
notes: Use as a quick checklist block.

heading: 2.0 The Science
body: Decision fatigue, fear of regret, and loss sensitivity increase at the decision stage. Clarity lowers cognitive load and builds confidence.

heading: Choice Overload
body: Too many options reduces action. Limiting to 2–3 best-fit options increases confidence.

heading: Framing
body: Guests respond to outcomes more than specs; translate features into real-life benefits.

heading: Loss Aversion
body: Guests fear making a wrong choice more than they desire a perfect choice; reduce perceived risk through calm clarity.
bullets: Normalize big decision|Remove uncertainty|Clear next step
notes: Use in 'I need to think' handling.

heading: Commitment & Consistency
body: Small yeses create momentum; use micro-commitments that feel respectful and permission-based.

heading: Peak-End
body: Guests remember emotional peaks and how the process ends; plan one 'aha' moment and end with a calm summary.

heading: Clarity First
body: Before numbers, ensure the guest understands why it fits and what value it creates.

heading: Two-Layer Value
body: Every key point includes feature→outcome and outcome→feeling.

heading: Summarize in Their Words
body: Use a short recap that mirrors the guest’s priorities and reasons.

heading: Decision Point Question
body: Use a calm, respectful commitment question—never pressure.
notes: Make this a standard phrase set.

heading: Transition to Numbers
body: Present numbers as the next helpful step, not a confrontation.
bullets: Would it be helpful if…|Keep it simple|Stay calm

heading: Value Recap Script
body: Confirm priorities and link the chosen vehicle to the guest’s reasons.

heading: Value Bridge Sentence
body: Need→Feature→Outcome/Feeling→Real-life moment.
bullets: Because you mentioned…|This helps give you…|Especially when…

heading: Decision Point Questions
body: Use one of three respectful micro-commitments.

heading: I Need to Think Response
body: Validate, then isolate uncertainty with one question and simplify.

heading: Role-Play Focus
body: Practice value bridges, decision point questions, and transitions to numbers under real-world uncertainty.

heading: Worksheet Purpose
body: Reinforce value mapping, decision point readiness, and clean transition language to numbers.
